intro: Lappula cupulata var. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are usually lobed or toothed, and the plant produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
